Opportunity_Name: Florida Blue Foundation Maternal Health Grants
Eligibility_Notes: 501(c)(3), maternal health focus, AI solutions preferred
Strategic_Notes: HIGHEST PRIORITY - AI-powered solutions specifically requested. FIU is CURRENT GRANTEE.
Key_Requirements: AI solutions preferred; under-resourced communities; maternal health outcomes
Funding_Priorities: Maternal health, AI/technology, health equity, community health
Internal_Notes: DEADLINE PASSED (Oct 6 2025). Focus on renewal planning for current grant.

Required_Documents: Renewal application, progress report, outcomes data
Strategic_Notes: CRITICAL - Current grant ending. Contact foundation NOW about renewal process.
Key_Requirements: Progress metrics, outcomes documentation, sustainability plan
Funding_Priorities: Health equity, community health
Internal_Notes: URGENT RENEWAL PLANNING NEEDED. 3-year grant ending ~end 2026.

Opportunity_Name: Health Foundation of South Florida Access to Care
Eligibility_Notes: 501(c)(3), South Florida focus, contact staff first
Required_Documents: Proposal narrative, budget, work plan, board list, 501(c)(3), Form 990, financials
Strategic_Notes: EXCEPTIONAL ALIGNMENT - Digital health technology and SDOH screening directly match HFSF priorities. CONTACT JANISSE FIRST.
Key_Requirements: Digital health, SDOH screening, enrollment outreach, telehealth
Funding_Priorities: Digital health technology, SDOH integration, safety net capacity, policy/advocacy
Internal_Notes: Prior grantee. HFSF priorities perfectly match Thrive/NHELP. Must contact before applying.

Eligibility_Notes: Section 330-funded or look-alike ONLY - academic medical centers NOT eligible. FQHC partnership required.
Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Direct fit for mobile health operations. 10 awards available. REQUIRES FQHC PARTNERSHIP.
Key_Requirements: NACHC membership in good standing. Academic medical centers NOT directly eligible - must partner with eligible FQHC.
Funding_Priorities: Mobile health operations, outreach, expansion
Internal_Notes: DEADLINE PASSED (Jun 23 2025). Monitor for 2026. FIU must partner with eligible FQHC to access funding.

Population_Focus: Children, families, seniors, people with disabilities
Eligibility_Notes: 501(c)(3) public charity, Miami-Dade focus, LOI by US mail
Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Local Miami-Dade foundation with perfect geographic fit.
Key_Requirements: 501(c)(3) public charity, FL registration, Miami-Dade benefit
Funding_Priorities: Health/human services for children/families/seniors/disabled, operating support
Internal_Notes: LOI must be submitted by US MAIL ONLY. Quarterly board review.

Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Direct fit for NHELP mobile unit operations.
Funding_Priorities: Mobile healthcare operations, sustainability
Internal_Notes: DEADLINE PASSED (Sep 30 2025). Monitor for 2026 cycle.

Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Health is explicit priority area. Two-year general operating funding.
Funding_Priorities: Health, Economic Stability, Inclusion, Arts, Environment, Youth
Internal_Notes: Bi-annual cycles. Subscribe to newsletter for announcements.

Eligibility_Notes: Health center or health center partner
Required_Documents: SF-424, budget, work plan, environmental docs
Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Mobile units and equipment. Monitor grants.gov for NOFOs.
Key_Requirements: Health center focus, medically underserved areas
Funding_Priorities: Primary care capacity, mobile units, equipment
Internal_Notes: Capital equipment and mobile unit support. Contact BPHCCapital@hrsa.gov.

Eligibility_Notes: 501(c)(3), research institutions, universities. NOTE: Evidence for Action requires CBO lead - universities cannot lead
Strategic_Notes: HIGH STRATEGIC VALUE - Major national health philanthropy. E4A requires CBO lead (universities cannot lead).
Key_Requirements: Health equity focus, community partnership. For E4A: CBO must be lead applicant.
Funding_Priorities: Health equity, systems change, data for equity
Internal_Notes: Monitor Active/Upcoming page. Sign up for funding alerts. E4A programs closing Dec 31 2026.

Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Planning grant. Focus on Community-Clinical Linkages domain.
Key_Requirements: At least 2 SDOH domains, multi-sector leadership team
Funding_Priorities: Community-Clinical Linkages, Food Security, Built Environment, Social Connectedness
Internal_Notes: 71 recipients since 2021. Planning grants can lead to implementation funding.

Strategic_Notes: HIGH PRIORITY - Multiple priorities match NHELP: seniors/aging in place/mental health.
Funding_Priorities: Disabilities, veterans, seniors aging in place, mental health, suicide prevention
Internal_Notes: Strong fit for NHELP populations. Community-based health services priority.

Opportunity_Name: HHS Office of Minority Health Demonstration Projects
Strategic_Notes: HIGH FIT - COPHI maternal health program. 4-year awards.
Funding_Priorities: SDOH barriers, maternal health (COPHI), preventive services
Internal_Notes: COPHI program specifically targets perinatal health. $475K-$600K/yr for up to 4 years.

Geographic_Focus: Priority cities: Detroit, Fresno, Memphis, New Orleans
Eligibility_Notes: INVITATION-ONLY CONFIRMED - unsolicited proposals NOT accepted
Strategic_Notes: PRIOR RELATIONSHIP - Leverage Catalyst Miami partnership. Miami is climate-vulnerable. INVITATION-ONLY.
Key_Requirements: INVITATION-ONLY - Do NOT submit unsolicited proposals. Build relationship through prior Catalyst Miami connection.
Funding_Priorities: Climate health, racial equity, community-driven solutions
Internal_Notes: INVITATION-ONLY CONFIRMED (Feb 2026). Health Program does NOT accept unsolicited proposals. Build relationship first.

Strategic_Notes: DEADLINE PASSED - Foundation now INVITATION-ONLY. Build relationship for future.
Funding_Priorities: Healthcare access, social services, education
Internal_Notes: DEADLINE PASSED (May 31 2025). Program now invitation-only. No public applications accepted.

Strategic_Notes: Strong fit for behavioral health integration with NHELP/Thrive.
Funding_Priorities: Comprehensive behavioral health, 24/7 crisis, care coordination, primary care integration
Internal_Notes: 4-year grants ~$1M/yr. Monitor Grants Dashboard for new NOFOs.

Strategic_Notes: Unrestricted operating support. Good for CHW infrastructure or mobile unit costs.

Internal_Notes: Awards typically ~$20K over 1-2 years. Check for FY26 cycle dates.

Strategic_Notes: SDOH focus aligns with NHELP. Testing/screening mentioned.

Strategic_Notes: Health equity focus. Screening and wellness mentioned.

Strategic_Notes: Large grants available. Health Innovation focus. AI interest (Magpie Literacy example).

Strategic_Notes: Community solutions focus. Two-stage LOI process.

Internal_Notes: LOI first, then invited full proposal.

Strategic_Notes: NOT traditional grant. Engage as community partner for potential collaboration.
